content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

It’s the last update this year (oh noe!), but I’ve got a bumper Christmas special for you packed with gorgeous new themes, handy tutorials, and some fine inspiration in the showcase.

Themes

Just when you start to think everyone put up their feet for Christmas already, along comes three (stellar) new themes.

First up, Pro Plus purchasers rejoice because you’ve got another new theme to play with over at StudioPress. Market is a third party theme from Restored 316, with out of the box styling support for WooCommerce, Genesis Simple Share, Simple Social Icons, Genesis Responsive Slider, Instagram Feed, and Genesis eNews Extended. Go grab it!

Market Theme Gets Your Genesis-Powered WordPress Site Noticed. https://t.co/IqGkwBtKnl Released on @studiopress by @restored316 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/cwE8oQL2Uj

— StudioPress (@studiopress) December 14, 2016

Second, check out the fantastic looking Harmony Pro from Jamie Mitchell. Really dig this one.

THEME LAUNCH: Personal, Beautiful & Thoughtful. Introducing the Harmony Pro theme for #genesiswp #WordPress https://t.co/VvmI0pVGxM pic.twitter.com/J5VdGJIxL5

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) December 17, 2016

And last, but definitely not least, Appfinite re-launch their Legacy theme. This is a bit of Genesis classic, so it’s great to see it getting a new look.

A Fresh New version of the Legacy Theme is here! Check it out & let us know what you think – https://t.co/zFl80nLbJy#genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/KRSUal6AmS

— appfinite (@appfinite) December 16, 2016

Showcase

Nice, clean site from Sacha Benda for pextech.co

New site for @pextechcolombia Responsible exploration with low social and environmental impact. #genesiswp https://t.co/lJbP8M5E1V pic.twitter.com/kB7cWiMIOr

— Sacha Benda (@saxisme) December 17, 2016

Ryan Rudolph for eatnic.com

Just launched this website for a local "farm to fork" restaurant! – https://t.co/XzvGvhLyNu – #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/RkQGNbs4lU

— Ryan Rudolph (@ryancrudolph) December 16, 2016

Pilcrow Pixel for honoroakbark.co.uk

Recently launched redesign for Forest Hill’s finest dog-walkers and trainers @honoroakbark: https://t.co/xnh805wnWJ #genesiswp #wordpress

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) December 16, 2016

Omar Al-Ansari re-launches his own site, alansari.io

Finally alansari.io redesignedhttps://t.co/I5M7NEgBHi#GenesisWP #WordPress

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) December 13, 2016

Theresa Wagar for criancasdobrasil.org

Excited to share my first non-English website! For an amazing outreach in Brasil. #genesiswp https://t.co/YYhcsA4aXY pic.twitter.com/DrURybjcnI

— Theresa Wagar (@TheresaWagar) December 12, 2016

Podcasts

On rethink.fm, Jackie’s chatting to Matt Pritchett on local development enviroments and why Matt’s building one of his own.

Talking local dev environments. What's out there + why Matt's building one of his own. #WordPress https://t.co/f5vVPzc1iY via @rethinkfm

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) December 17, 2016

On OfficeHours.fm, Carrie chats to Gordan Orlic on white-labelling plugins and WordPress.

Two of my fav people! @cdils & @webfactoryltd talk White-labeling #plugins & #WordPress (and a little rant) https://t.co/JDlprDFW3M pic.twitter.com/d31V5uJ3rp

— Kim Doyal (@kimdoyal) December 12, 2016

Best of the rest

Omar Al-Ansari shows you how to create a ‘meet the team’ page using custom post types in Genesis…

Create Meet the Team Page Using Custom Post Types in Genesishttps://t.co/iex6y5H940#WordPress #GenesisWP #ACF

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) December 15, 2016

…plus, adding a Google map with multiple custom markers in Genesis using Advanced Custom Fields.

Google Map with Multiple Custom Markers in Genesis using ACF

Sridhar Katakam on simplifying the code for registering multiple widget areas in Genesis

Simplifying the code for registering multiple widget areas in Genesis:https://t.co/ce0vGKrnmJ#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 14, 2016

League WP on how to replicate the single post template of the Journal theme…

How to Replicate Single Post Template of Journal Theme in #genesiswp https://t.co/1S4ZvI7o4o

— League WP (@league_wp) December 17, 2016

…plus, how to add Google Fonts to the visual editor in Genesis.

How to Add Google Fonts to Visual Editor in #GenesisWP https://t.co/ne3PKwK5KF

— League WP (@league_wp) December 15, 2016

A bit light on detail in this tweet ,but the folks at SPYR have started making some changes to their Genesis marketplace, bylt.me

We’ve quietly implemented step one in our re-imagining of #BYLT, our #genesiswp marketplace.https://t.co/Sy8WwQCoiS

— SPYR (@SPYR) December 14, 2016

And finally…

If I’m allowed to give a small plug to something I’m doing (after a year of plugging everyone else’s stuff 😉 ), I’ve started sharing links, notes and code snippets over at DesignToWebsite.com.

It’s been something I’m meaning to do for ages (and I mean a long time), but in a nutshell the plan is as I’m working on new project to just quickly add stuff to the site as I go.

There’s still a lot of improvements I want to make to it, but please do check it out and you can also subscribe for updates.

Developer Resources

—

That’s all for this week and – unless something crazy happens – this year from This Week in Genesis.

Until then I want to say thank you to every single person that has shared, commented, liked or taken the time to add something to this site. It is hugely appreciated.

I’ll be back in January. But if you’re doing something awesome with Genesis, add it to the site and I’ll tweet out the best things.

Until then, for those celebrating, I hope you have a very Merry Christmas and a very Happy New Year.

excerpt.rendered: It’s a bumper Christmas special packed with gorgeous new themes, handy tutorials, and some fine inspiration in the showcase.
